info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 28 at 9:34PM EDT until April 30 at 12:31AM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Blacksburg VA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Virginia... Roanoke (Staunton) River At Brookneal affecting Campbell, Halifax and Charlotte Counties. For the Roanoke River...including Roanoke, Pigg R Nr Sandy Level, Altavista, Brookneal, Randolph...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM EARLY SATURDAY MORNING TO SATURDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Roanoke (Staunton) River At Brookneal. * WHEN...From early Saturday morning to Saturday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 23.0 feet, Low-lying fields and woods are flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:45 PM EDT Friday the stage was 17.4 feet and rising. - Forecast...The river will rise above flood stage early Saturday morning to 24.2 feet. It will then fall below flood stage Saturday afternoon and then continue falling to 11.3 feet Sunday evening. It will rise to 15.4 feet Monday evening. It will then fall again and remain below flood stage. - Flood stage is 23.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 24.2 feet on 04/14/2020. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Saturday morning at 930 AM EDT.
